body: @jzu-guru thanks!  Have you tried the code at https://github.com/apache/netbeans/issues/3962#issuecomment-1664507172  ? Perhaps increase the `maxTries` value.  Can you reproduce with that?

No, I haven't. Wasn't aware of this code until now. I gave it a quick shot with my official NB 22 installation (I'm currently not at the machine with the dev build)) and increased the maxTries to 15.
As a result, in my Netbeans all sometext1 to sometext123456789101112131415 lines were present in the code file. On Notepad, all lines are present, but lines 2, 5, 14 and 16 were empty, so the content in Notepad looked like:

sometext

sometext12
sometext123

sometext12345
sometext123456
sometext1234567
sometext12345678
sometext123456789
sometext12345678910
sometext1234567891011
sometext123456789101112

sometext1234567891011121314

I'm not sure if this demonstrates the issue or if it just is some sync/timing problem. Because it always failed for one line only and worked again for the next line.

If it helps, my current workspace:
Product Version: Apache NetBeans IDE 22
Java: 21.0.3; Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 21.0.3+7-LTS-152
Runtime: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 21.0.3+7-LTS-152
System: Windows 10 version 10.0 running on amd64; UTF-8; de_DE (nb)
@jzu-guru that is exactly the issue, so it seems you are also affected

Ok, then I'll try to do some System.out log messages in the dev build to see if there are any differences between the working and failing lines. Could take two or three days until I find the time for it, but will respond with the results.
Any hints to where and what I should log would be welcome. I have zero knowledge of Netbeans code ;-)
Which file or files do I need to edit for this issue?

Thanks for the quick response.
Sounds like this isn't a feature many people need.
We did not get feedback from our client yet.
But I guess it is less time consuming if we fix it on the application side.
will merge later today

> I'm disinclined to adding the UI in this module itself. I'm a little worried about this module growing in size and dependencies. Maybe if we could make the dependency from `refactoring.java` optional I'd be less concerned. Some platform projects have use for one without the other!

I'll try to make the dependency the other way (`java.file.launcher` depending on `refactoring.java`), so that you can use `refactoring.java` without traces of source file launcher.
Please provide a minimal reproducer.
This is the behavior of the LSP module. Needs to be checked if it is even possible to configure the typescript LSP, so that it conforms to NB default behavior.
This is the behavior of the LSP module. Needs to be checked if it is even possible to configure the typescript LSP, so that it conforms to NB default behavior.

Yes I thought so too. I think it is not possible to get everything 100% from the LSP so we need to interop with it and extends the stuff. But I dunno yet. I thought I will just add this w/o touching LSP.

That feature is not supported in NB.
I supported it with the plugin (https://github.com/junichi11/netbeans-php-enhancements).
Did you install it?
If you installed it, please report it there. Thanks.
Please provide an example code to reproduce it. Thanks.

awesome, thanks for the fix!

@DJ-Raven could you update the commit author to your full name like in your last PR?
for comparison:
 - this PR: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7799.patch
 - last PR: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7332.patch

```
 git commit --amend --author="Author Name <email@address.com>" --no-edit
```
and simply force push

sorry for the delay - I kept getting distracted by other things. Will try to take a look at this this evening - lets try go get this cool feature in.

edit: looks good, I believe most similar windows do have a preview now:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c69c65ae-dee2-40bf-9d69-98db958e8f92)
@mbien already push

So, some results so far. The issue is pretty random. To more or less reliably get at least 2 or more missing copy/paste in the notepad win, I had to raise the maxtries to about 50. This extends the duration of each test run. But at least with a native NbClipboard.java from Tag 22 this way I can reliably reproduce two or more copy/paste errors per run.

But now the funny thing is coming. I've filled up the NbClipboard.java with several System.out.println(...). More or less half of the methods had one directly on entry, so was the first line in each affected method. Wasn't in all of the methods, but around every second one. Because I don't know where to look closer I've done some random choosing of some methods. I've changed nothing else in the source code, just added these println(). But this version now runs through the test without any loss of any copy&paste cycle. I've done three tests with 50 tries each. During that span the normal NbClipboard.java would have had at least 6 or more losses.

So my guess is, that this issue (or to be more precise: the issue which will be shown by the test case) is some timing/sync/context change problem. Unfortunately I'm not able to tell you, which method should be slowed down or be "interrupted" by a println() to show this effect. This would need some more of these long running tests, and currently I'm out of time, at least for the rest of this week.
well late :D will need rebase.
This feels like a data race or cache sync problem.  In Java today, class level member fields should really be marked final or volatile because of non-volatile optimizations that remove code paths.

this did also repair the "pin tab" feature. I can now open multiple terminals, pin them and when NB is restarted it will restore them again -> great fix!
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01805b0a-45ce-47fc-be0f-179225c560ad)
It the same for all php projects. Would you like me send you a php project?

I can also report that after 3.5 months of usage, in my platform app and my working IDE, I have no encountered no new problems relating to this patch (which replaced my older hack for fixing the elusive NETBEANS-4754).
rebased, removed string templates and fixed a bug
I also made a PR for the search results #7779

@ltheussl thanks for the info. With that this is trivial to reproduce. I created a PR, that should fix the problem (tested locally). It would be great if you could test the nightly build: 

[Checkpage](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7796/checks), [direct download](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/suites/28847143361/artifacts/1978890373)

@jzu-guru You could do a "research" on what is the effect of  a "dummy/empty copy", in your logs, that could possibly point to a direction. The mysterious thing is why the hidden copied content is being revealed by this magic operation.

@eirikbakke I think this would the right time to merge this, as we are early in the cycle and at least my runs in the last few weeks at work looked clean. PRs don't get better when the are just lying around.

@jzu-guru 

> So my guess is, that this issue (or to be more precise: the issue which will be shown by the test case) is some timing/sync/context change problem. Unfortunately I'm not able to tell you, which method should be slowed down or be "interrupted" by a println() to show this effect. This would need some more of these long running tests, and currently I'm out of time, at least for the rest of this week.

My recollection is that logging/tracking/observing changes the behavior and has always made it more difficult to pin this down (damn you heisenberg). Maybe something like

```
PrintWriter myOut = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("foo.out"), HUGE_SIZE_IF_NEEDED));
```

where `myOut` should be a drop in replacement for `System.out`, would be help to minimize the perturbation. At least it's buffered and there won't be any locking involved.

(Care must be taken for flushing `myOut`.)
@matthiasblaesing Great, merged! Thanks for the useful discussions.
I removed the "Avoid calling Clipboard.add/removeFlavorListener from the Event Dispatch Thread" commit and left the other two.

Also added a comment that MAX_RETRIES is just a fail-safe, and that the loop will stop earlier normally. (I left it at 10 rather than 7 to avoid having to justify the exact number with a long irrelevant comment.)

We may not often reproduce it without an example. So, please always attach an example code(as a comment) or a minimal project(as a zip file) to reproduce it. Thanks.

Did you try to delete your cache directory?(see: Help > About)
I cannot say anything regarding your actual problem, but are your servers really running with Java <= 7? Because PermGen has been removed in JDK 8.

Excellent, thanks for the quick turn-around! I confirm that it works with your build.
Cheers, -Lukas

That's right, I meant "out of memory". 
"deploy on save" shouldn't redeploy until any changes has been saved. But not before.
LGTM

Yeah, I don't think the alignment problems in older LAFs are due to this patch; I saw them when trying Nimbus without the patch, for instance. (In any case I don't think much effort needs to be spent on the older LAFs at this point; they just served as a useful "test case" for the patch.)
Merged it--thanks again for the patch!
Thank @mbien @eirikbakke for review.

>  I don't think the alignment problems in older LAFs are due to this patch;

yes, this is not what I meant. This dialog is somewhat special since it uses the old grid bag layout which doesn't implement text baseline alignment for neighboring components if i remember correctly. Two combo boxes are also multi line fields with dynamic height - so this is to be expected that it won't look nice on all LAFs. (I remember starring at the dialog a while while doing https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/3393)

What i meant was that the GTK laf specifically looks inconsistent everywhere else too. Toolbar icons have the wrong size and every combo box looks different. I set `-J-Djdk.gtk.version=2` for VisualVM to make it somewhat useable (fixes the toolbars at least).

I am wondering if we should filter it out from the LAF list? I guess users could still use the flag to force it.
Thanks for testing!
@mbien thanks for checking

> I am wondering if we should filter it out from the LAF list? I guess users could still use the flag to force it.

Perhaps? Or otherwise advertise that we really recommend FlatLAF over the other ones.

The main reason to keep the older LAFs around is that it's useful to have each of the basic Java LAFs available in the list for people who are developing Swing apps and would like to see what each one of them looks like in the context of the full IDE. It's also useful during NetBeans IDE development, to test Swing code changes with different LAFs to make sure the code does not make accidental assumptions about specific LAF implementation details.

> I set -J-Djdk.gtk.version=2 for VisualVM to make it somewhat useable (fixes the toolbars at least).

I think we used to have that setting as default in NetBeans, until https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5862 removed it. Maybe certain issues appeared to have been fixed in the JDK, but others were not.
Thanks! Merged.
removed the test commits and updated the error messages a bit

Bad news: This issue if even more random than I thought. I've done some more runs, always with 50 tries (copy and paste events), which means one test runs for about 10 minutes. Some runs with println some with an unchanged .java file. Absolutely every run went without any copy/paste loss. This makes it really hard to impossible to tell if a change solves anything. :-( 
It seems to also depend on other things, maybe the alternative load of the compuer? Which applications run besides Netbeans? How the other appliactions treat the system clipboard? The pattern of how and when someone switches between the appliactions? Or maybe just completely by accident/by chance?

From my point I'm not sure of how I should proceed now. The essential thing is, we neeed a procedure which can tell if a change has at least a great chance to solve this issue. Maybe I should extend the test to run for an hour or so? But then it can take a long time to check any changes, because this then can only be done in spare times when I don't need my computer otherwise. Means one max. two test runs per day?

Or is here someone who has a better repoducible rate with the test application?

The randomness is already known and currently there is no way to predict or replicate it as the mechanism is unknown. Only the FINEST setting has an effect reducing the frequency of appearance. What about the empty copy workaround? Does the [eirikbakke](https://github.com/eirikbakke) patch has an effect?

That is exactly the point: I can't tell you if anything has any effect, because **all** of my recent tests (about 20-30, don't know exactly, but has tried over three hours) worked without any issue, regardless of what I've done or which code I've used

it is like chasing a ghost, so one of the apparent ways is to trace the only known reveal operation, witch is the "empty copy". (without using FINEST). I use the jLogMan plugin for switch of log settings

I summarize my findings.
The copy and paste from/to Netbeans works 1 or few times and after it is unusable anymore until I use CTRL+SHIFT+D and I choose to paste one of the cache strings available in the popup list.
The other way is to use DRAG and DROP, under this case the copy and paste works always to/from Netbeans.
This provides the evidence that the use of the clipboard is correct along with the drag and drop feature... so I expect the bugged cut/paste can be revised by inspecting the D&D code to see how the clipboard is used the right way.
This could also promote the reuse of the good code to solve this forever.
Please check #7757

> Please check #7757

@matthiasblaesing is there any chance to get this in a patch and not having to wait 4 months for the next release?!
@albilu you can always build from the patch branch or from master once the patch is merged.
@albilu if you can't build from source, I can rerun the CI pipeline for the PR and you could test that build and potentially use it until NB24.
Works for me.Thanks

the repo you linked does not seem to contain a netbeans ant project (or any other IDE project) so you can't open it right away. To interface with arbitrary ant projects you can use the free-form project wizard under: `new project -> java with ant -> java free-form project` and then map the actions to the build (default usually works).

maven projects are different since they have a standard structure, those can be simply opened without extra configuration
There was a contrib plugin that tried autodetection for ant, but it was never mainlined. So @mbien is right, this is not a bug.

I have seen some users noting that control-X can solve the issue for them. I have tested this with the test code. The conclusion is that indeed this plays a significant role in the appearance frequency, acting similarly as if "the FINEST" log setting was active. Of course tests have been run without it. 
control-C: 5 errors / 10 iterations
control-X: 2 errors / 64 iterations

So I assume that using FINEST and control-X can indeed improve the frequency of appearance further. For what is worth.
We cannot then be sure about the DRAG and DROP as it needs a test code that supports it. But a guess is that it could act as control-X, but nothing is for sure.

A slightly modified version of the test code with console messages: https://gist.github.com/istinnstudio/8f8f94a675a77cedb3ca3e5b6f558945

I tested without secure-admin and that works as it should and that might make sense. I'm missing the step where you install a valid TLS certificate for the Payara Server. Did you just don't mention that or did you not?

Please provide the message.log of a session where you tested the access and the contents is missing.

For those who are new to the background of this issue, the very first bug report I am aware of is here: [88161](https://bz.apache.org/netbeans/show_bug.cgi?id=88161). It is not exactly the same issue but similar and includes the way optional clipboard hack created as to be some kind a solution, but at the end was not. You have to be patient to follow this old thread, but could reveal hidden gems, after [comment 88](https://bz.apache.org/netbeans/show_bug.cgi?id=88161#c88) there are interesting posts that could have some value.

Hi! Thanks for the reply. Could you pls clarify what you mean "tested without secure-admin"? In case you mean you have added "Local Domain" - yes, that works fine.

The issue I have reported is about trying to add "Remote Domain", pls. see the screenshot below:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8736290d-ae2c-4c1d-ae14-b51e72969f77)

In order for NB to be able to control (deploy) app on the Remote Domain - DAS has to be activated on the remote Payara (at least it was so ~6 years ago when I last used such approach ;) ).

As per certificates - no, I was not installing any additional certificates, as it has to work by default with the existing certificate coming with Payara/Glassfish.

Messages.log - attaching. I have closed NB23, deleted previous message.log, launched NB23, added Remote Domain, tried to access it / refresh it, nothing worked. Closed NB23 and copied `messages.log`.
[messages.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17179989/messages.log)

Let me know pls in case further clarifications are required from me.
Thank you!
I tested in remote mode and retestet. Please check if right clicking on the server entry and choosing "Refresh" resolves it.

Can you pls list your steps? Also could you pls clarify what you mean "tested without secure-admin" as per your first reply?
"Refresh" - of course it was tried as well, didn't help.
Thanks!

Here is a quick and dirty, untested plugin to force a rescan: https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/netbeans-project-rescan

It determines the roots for the project directory, then destroys the index/cache for these and issues a rescan. This is untested and each uses kills a cute kitten, but maybe it helps.

@bobl01: I encountered a similar problem, illustrated [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/73611827/230513), when migrating an old Ant/JavaFX2 project. For recent JavaFX with Maven, I like the [javafx-maven-archetypes](https://github.com/openjfx/javafx-maven-archetypes). Once installed , Simple and FXML archetypes will appear in the `File > New Project > Java with Maven` dialog. The command-line equivalent is seen [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/78541461/230513).

> Yes, at some point we could probably do with not parsing HTML5 with an HTML 3.2 parser! 😄

That would be great. The current HTMLJavadocParser.parseMember method doesn't work for a lot of methods of OpenJDK 21 that don't have “a” tags in their sections. I can't follow the quirks of the current state machine (eg. hrpos and A_OPEN/A_CLOSE), so I can't produce a reliable patch./PR Should I open an issue about it? Thanks.

The [comment 88](https://bz.apache.org/netbeans/show_bug.cgi?id=88161#c88) beginning phrases say that: "One of the biggest reason why we need fast query to clipboard was explorer. Whenever people selected new node, we needed to update state of paste action." 

These words resonate with my experience with PHP-based "pgAdmin" application. While everyday having issues with NetBeans clipboard never have I noticed any issues between NetBeans and pgAdmin. So the external window (copy source, paste target) matters. Now pgAdmin is PHP-based and therefore is presumably slower integrated into Windows than native applications. Which hints on the possible problem in the code in NetBeans which detects and reacts on external Windows events like changing active window.

Ok - my suspicion was, that the remote control code in the payara extension might fail without a valid certificate (I think it should), but I tested with MDNS resolver (`<hostname>.local`) and connection worked with and without secure-admin (aka with http and https on port 4848).

For the steps I followed your requested steps.

I tried to find the right loggers to get the right debug output and this should do it (run with cmd):

```
<path_to_netbeans>/bin/netbeans64.exe -J-Dorg.netbeans.modules.payara.common.CommonServerSupport.level=FINEST -J-Dorg.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.server.state.StatusJob.level=FINEST -J-Dorg.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.server.state.StatusJob$ListenerPortCheck.level=FINEST -J-Dorg.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.level=FINEST
```

**_DO NOT POST THE RESULT WITHOUT REVIEW!!! The URL, user and password for the DAS will be printed!_**

I see this (password replaced by `PPPPPPPPP`, hostname replaced by `HHHHHHHHHHHH`):

```
FINER [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.server.state.RunnerTask]: Asadmin command task for server Payara Server in state ONLINE started.
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.utils.ServerUtils]: ServerUtils.isSecurePort.socket
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Runner call() method called on URL http://HHHHHHHHHHHH:4848/__asadmin/version thread Payara Status Tasks
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Setting HTTP connection attributes: timeout = 3.000 user = admin password = PPPPPPPPP
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Using "Basic" authorization with user and password
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Connecting to HHHHHHHHHHHH:4848
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Receiving response, code: 302
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Location moved to https://HHHHHHHHHHHH:4848/__asadmin/version
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Setting HTTP connection attributes: timeout = 3.000 user = admin password = PPPPPPPPP
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Using "Basic" authorization with user and password
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Connecting to HHHHHHHHHHHH:4848
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.admin.Runner]: Receiving response, code: 200
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling]: Reading response from HHHHHHHHHHHH:4848
FINEST [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling]: Manifest message: Payara Server 6.2024.9 #badassfish (build 23)
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.server.state.StatusJob$ListenerVersion]: Status check version command result: SUCCESS
FINE [org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.server.state.StatusJob]: Command check transition SUCCESS: ONLINE -> ONLINE
````

This makes sense. The status check connects to the DAS, gets a redirect from http to https and the queries the `/__asadmin/version` path to query the server version.

What do you get?

> @HowardUngar please squash the commits into a single one. I'll let then activate the test build and if that is ok, I'll integrate.

Sqashed.  My first squash so please let me know if I did it right or not.

@HowardUngar this looks semi correct. Commit f710db294026b176c8398708fac32ecd34a51f85 is the squashed commits, but there should be no merge with the original commits.

This is the current history of your change:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/26ce2899-646e-49c8-a187-fb1027e6bc68)

Only the commit f710db294026b176c8398708fac32ecd34a51f85 (bottom most) should be there. The other commits should be gone and then the merge is not necessary. The way to archive this with the CLI git is:

```
# checkout your working branch
git checkout my-jboss8-work
# move the branch pointer to the squashed commit
git reset --hard f710db294026b176c8398708fac32ecd34a51f85
# Push it into the repository (force necessary as the history was rewritten)
git push -f
```

How can I point to the "sources" using the browse option?  Thanks! @mbien
Looks like I got it to work.  Please confirm if this looks right and it's ready to pull.
This might help: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46866009/is-there-a-force-push-option-in-github-desktop

I can reproduce it. What is the version of the payara installation you are using to register the remote domain?

Edit: I would wager, that the version of the payara installation and the DAS don't match. That in turn lets verification fail and remote control is broken. That does not happen locally, as the running version is identical with the target version.
probably ok to merge as new feature, but I fear that this might confuse some of the javadoc editor hints since they probably don't expect markdown.
@matthiasblaesing   The node.js sources download worked as expected. The native node.js objects are now known ( defined ) and code completion is working as expected. Excellent job!

@matthiasblaesing Well spoke too soon, the IDE is still showing that the native objects are not "declared" but the object completion is working and the download of the node.js sources completed without errors. I will restart the IDE and see if that "fixes" the "not declared" warnings.
@matthiasblaesing The node.js downloads is fixed so this can be closed. The "not declared" stuff looks like it has other known fixes, so yes it is unrelated. Thank you!
Where is the reproducer for the problem?
@mbien yeah, I had a look at the module-info.class ;-). Thanks.
This change is trivial and was successfully tested by two affected users (one of them being the author), merging.
@antoniojvelezq you could have simplified this by just providing the project. Anyway, yes, the projects seems to be incorrectly generated, as JUnit 5 is put onto the classpath.

Thank you for your reply and I'm glad that you were able to reproduce the issue!

As per versions - initially I was testing it as follows:
- on local machine I had version 6.2024.6 (but I was sure that it was 6.2024.5 - thus I got the issue);
- on remote machine I tried versions 6.2024.5 and 6.2024.9 - that didn't work as reported;

Having your input in mind - I aligned payara versions on my local machine and remote machine:
- once I aligned local version and remote to have v6.2024.5 on both ends - I was able to see remote Payara online status properly:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19d4699c-2889-4efb-a840-5115b3391737)

Thank you for helping to resolve this issue! I do remember that before (~6 years ago when I last used deployment to remote domain) it was not making any difference if remote and local versions were bit different (as my test on NB 11.3 showns), thus I didn't pay much attention to it.
In case it is a requirement now to have the same versions of payara on local and remote machines - I am fine with that and absolutely okay to have this issue closed.
From the other side if, at least, some warnings about local vs. remote versions mismatch could be added in scope of this issue - it would be beneficial for other users of NB who potentially could get in the same situation.
Thus it is up to you how to proceed with this issue.

Thank you once again! ;)

I apologize I didn't pay enough attention to the original PR.

I believe the launchers are doing some magic to find JDKs (unless specified explicitly), some platform-specific. (And some not properly updated/doubtful.) Like:
https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/c5731c940cc096eeeae6e22a9865bdf89098412e/platform/o.n.bootstrap/launcher/windows/jvmlauncher.cpp#L402
https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/c5731c940cc096eeeae6e22a9865bdf89098412e/platform/o.n.bootstrap/launcher/unix/nbexec#L134

Replicating this in the extension(s) seems a bit weird. The Oracle extension does this:
https://github.com/oracle/javavscode/blob/423c4812e2541a0dff62bac2a18431e98a820ec2/vscode/src/extension.ts#L1014

It apparently has its own problems with detecting the missing JDK on Windows, but I generally like the approach - we leave the JDK detection on the launcher, and if the launcher fails due to the missing JDK, we take corrective action.

I think I am fine with doing this PR as a hotfix, but long-term, I think it would be better to use an approach similar to the Oracle extension - i.e. leave the JDK resolution on the launcher, and just watch for trouble; only improve the detection that something went wrong.

> 
> Replicating this in the extension(s) seems a bit weird. The Oracle extension does this: https://github.com/oracle/javavscode/blob/423c4812e2541a0dff62bac2a18431e98a820ec2/vscode/src/extension.ts#L1014
> 

Good point. I'll work on that in NB24 timeframe, it's much better. But I'd appreciate if the launcher / NB startup printed some parseable message that contains the `java.home` and the detected java version for the case it does find Java, but an invalid version. With the path printed to stderr, one can inform the user better.
